channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-1] [hive] redundant expression evaluation in group by stage 1
item.description:
We can be smarter in terms of this list of what parameters we evaluate in the first stage, we should only evaluate those that are common across the group by clauses.

All expressions and aggregation function parameters are evaluated in the first stage thereby increasing data flow. It might be better to only evaluate common expressions
item.summary: [hive] redundant expression evaluation in group by stage 1

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
2 extremes are:

1. send all columns that are used in at least one group by.
2. send all group-by keys (eliminating duplicates)

I think we can first try to eliminating duplicates (so we become 2). That will give us the most improvements for common multi group bys.
Later we can think about other optimizations like in the description.

item.title: [HIVE-9] [hive] redundant columns being passed in group by stage 1
item.description: In the first map-reduce stage, all input columns are copied currently. Instead, we should walk over the filter and projections for that destination and only copy columns which occur there
item.summary: [hive] redundant columns being passed in group by stage 1

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Agree. This applies to the hash-based (multiple) group by I guess, because the sort-based (single) group by already pre-compute the target key and aggregation columns so only those that are necessary are passed.
This should have already been addressed as part of predicate pushdown. Will verify and close out.

item.title: [HIVE-10] [Hive] filter is executed after the join
item.description: Filter is not pushed above the join in Hive currently. This can be pretty expensive if the filter is highly selective.
item.summary: [Hive] filter is executed after the join

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Was fixed as part of the big merge.

Currently, we don't support general predicate push up However, if the predicate is present in the ON clause of the join, it is pushed up to the map stage

item.title: [HIVE-41] Expose various hive table options through create table query.
item.description: Lot of table options are not exposed through DDL. Only way to access these options are through programmatic API which can be cumbersome. This JIRA should expose retention, create time, last access time, owner, generic key/val params, serde options etc. Some of these should be session level variables instead of DDL options.
item.summary: Expose various hive table options through create table query.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: all the above are exposed using syntax 'alter table <> set <>'

item.title: [HIVE-49] [Hive] display column header on CLI
item.description:
The result row(s) on CLI are displayed without column header.

It would be useful to be able to set header on or off by users.

for example,
hive> SET HEAD [ON|OFF] /* similar to oracle sql*plus syntax */
or
hive> SET [GLOBAL|SESSION] HEADER=[ON|OFF] /* similar to mysql's "SET" syntax */

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
+1 to this.

this is very useful and it is quite simple to add to the CliDriver code.

+1

At least a programmatic interface to get to the column names would be nice.
Got resolved as part of HIVE-138

item.title: [HIVE-58] [hive] join condition does not allow a simple filter
item.description:
In the join condition, a simple filter condition cannot be specified.

For example,
select .... from A join B ON (A.a = B.b and A.x = 10);

is not supported. This can be very useful specially in case of outer joins.
item.summary: [hive] join condition does not allow a simple filter

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.title: [HIVE-59] [hive] duplicate expression elimination for group by stage 1
item.description:
In the first job we evaluate all the input columns + all group by clause expressions + parameters to all the aggregation functions and do not eliminate all the duplicates because we treat expression resolution and column resolution differently.

Consider the following:

src(key, value)

select src.key, sum(src.value) from src group by src;

Both src.key and src.value will be added twice - one from src's row resolver and one each from group expression and parameter. It is needed that way filter looks at (table, column) in row resolver, whereas group by expression looks
at (", COLREF table column)
item.summary: [hive] duplicate expression elimination for group by stage 1

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
